instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.P1V5S0_EN: What is P1V5S0_EN? P1V5S0_EN is an enable signal that turns on the PP1V5_S0 power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message:
board was liquid damaged. there was some corrosion by the usb area.i cleaned up. now the board boot up but no audio coming from it. external usb mouse and hard drive are working.
system report showing [B]I[/B]ntel High Definition Audio but audio id is zero. so device couldn't be found?

i dont have another i/o magsafe board to test. but the original board looked really clean.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message: All audio is on the IO board. Bad IO board/cable/connector is the most likely.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message: hi duke, i've tried 2 more IO board/cables and still no audio. connector on the logic board is good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6210</CHIP> area looks good?
Check if any pin of LIO connector is moving; not sufficient to look with microscope sometime.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message:
LIO connector is in mint condition, nothing is moving.

<CHIP>U6210</CHIP> was corroded. i did put a new one there before i made this thread. but not sure if i did a job. that thing is so tiny, making difficult to reball. any way i can check if replacement chip is working?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message:
It will work without <CHIP>U6210</CHIP>. All that is needed to make the left speaker work is on the IO board. <SIGNAL>AUD_GPIO_3</SIGNAL> should not be shorted and be high of course. 
Your audio device is not even recognized so check all HDA lines at J4700

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message:
no voltage on <SIGNAL>AUD_GPIO_3</SIGNAL> and not shorted....do i even measure voltage?

on <CHIP>U7770</CHIP>:
Pin4 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = I get 3.3v
Pin6 - <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL> = i get 1.8V
Pin3 - <SIGNAL>P1V5S0_EN</SIGNAL> = i get 1.9V
pin1 - <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> = i get 0v



j4700
3.29v on Pin22 of <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>
0v on pin34,36 of <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message: Looks like a dead <CHIP>U7770</CHIP> to me, if <SIGNAL>1V5_S0</SIGNAL> is not shorted.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no audio.
threads.message:
sound is back :). i think i made a mistake initially , was soldered the wrong orientation. i've replaced with another one anyway. 

thread closed.
